name: George Bunny Pillow Panel
description: Now you can make your very own George bunny pillow! Take George on all kinds of adventures and tag your photos with George's hashtag: #georgebunny! Finished pillow measures approx. 6" in diameter when stuffed. Materials Needed: - 1 George bunny pillow panel (included!) - 8"x8" scrap of backing fabric - Fiber fill - Coordinating thread - Hand-sewing needle, scissors, and a marking pen Panel comes with instructions for finishing your pillow! Printed on 100% cotton fabric. *Please note you're purchasing a pillow panel, not a finished pillow.*

name: Lined Drawstring Bag PDF Pattern
description: Easy lined drawstring bag sewing pattern, featuring eight sizes and make-your-own size instructions! There is a bag for everything in this pattern! Sizes range from tiny (4" tall!), to big (26" tall!), or create your own size to fit your needs! 8-page PDF pattern includes: - 8 bag sizes with yardage requirements and cutting instructions - Detailed how-to for creating your own bag size - Bag construction tutorial Fabric Requirements can be seen in second image. Tools & Notions: - Coordinating thread - Water soluble pen - Safety Pin - Clear acrylic ruler - General sewing supplies (machine, iron, pins, etc) *Please note this is a PDF pattern download, you will need Adobe Reader to view this pattern. *You will receive an email (to your paypal address), with the instructions and link for downloading the pattern. Please note the link expires after 3 downloads, so be sure to save the pattern to your computer!

name: Half-Square Triangle Sampler Quilt PDF Pattern
description: Create twelve blocks using half-squares triangles, discover the possibilities they provide. By the time you finish this quilt, you’ll be more than comfortable adding half-square triangles to your quilting projects! We'll explore two different methods for creating HSTs as well. Quilt finishes at 54”x67”. Fabric Requirements: - 8 fat quarters of print fabric - 1 1/4 yards of solid background fabric - 2/3 yards of sashing fabric - 1 yard of border fabric - 3 1/2 yards of backing fabric - 1 3/4 yards of 90" wide cotton batting - 1/2 yard of binding fabric 7-page PDF pattern includes: - Yardage Requirements and Cutting Instructions - Layout Diagrams - Quilt Top Assembly Instructions - Limited Quilt Finishing Instructions *Please note this is a PDF pattern download, you will need Adobe Reader to view this pattern. *You will receive an email (to your paypal address), with the instructions and link for downloading the pattern. Please note the link expires after 3 downloads, so be sure to save the pattern to your computer!

name: Color Hex Quilt PDF Pattern
description: Two playful hexagon quilts! Colors from the traditional color wheel are used to create a bold ring design. Floral Hex version is perfect for featuring your favorite prints! Suitable for intermediate quilters. Quilt Finishes at 45"x45” Color Hex - Fabric Requirements: - 1/8 yard of 12 solid colored fabrics (or FQs) - 1 1/2 yards of background fabric - 3 yards of backing fabric* - 1 1/2 yards of 90" wide cotton batting - 1/2 yard of binding fabric Floral Hex - Fabric Requirements: - 1/8 yard of 19 solid colored fabrics (or FQs) - 1 yard of background fabric - 3 yards of backing fabric* - 1 1/2 yards of 90" wide cotton batting - 1/2 yard of binding fabric *Optional pieced backing, requires only 1 1/2 yards of backing fabric plus scraps. 6-page PDF pattern includes: - Yardage Requirements and Cutting Instructions - Printable Templates - Layout Diagrams - Quilt Top Assembly Instructions - Limited Quilt Finishing Instructions *Please note this is a PDF pattern download, you will need Adobe Reader to view this pattern. *You will receive an email (to your paypal address), with the instructions and link for downloading the pattern. Please note the link expires after 3 downloads, so be sure to save the pattern to your computer!

name: Side Braid Quilt PDF Pattern
description: A quick and easy, fat quarter friendly, quilt pattern! This throw sized pattern can be made using two different sized rectangles. The Big Braid uses large pieces and the Mini Braid uses pieces half the size. Construction is the same for both versions. Suitable for comfortable beginners. Quilt finishes at 60”x78” Fabric Requirements: - 20 print fat quarters (or 1/4 yard cuts) - 1 1/2 yards of solid fabric - 5 yards of backing fabric - 2 yards of 90" wide cotton batting - 1/2 yard of binding fabric I’ve included piece totals for both styles so you can easily cut from scraps! 4-page PDF pattern includes: - Yardage Requirements and Cutting Instructions - Layout Diagrams - Quilt Top Assembly Instructions - Limited Quilt Finishing Instructions *Please note this is a PDF pattern download, you will need Adobe Reader to view this pattern. *You will receive an email (to your paypal address), with the instructions and link for downloading the pattern. Please note the link expires after 3 downloads, so be sure to save the pattern to your computer!

name: Arithmetic Quilt PDF Pattern
description: A bold, geometric, plus quilt pattern using simple patchwork techniques. In this pattern, you'll find instructions / measurements / fabric requirements for plus quilts using 2.5" squares (for scrap lovers!), 4.5" squares and 8" squares. You can choose from six quilt sizes: Baby, Throw, Twin, Double, Queen, and King! So, you've got 18 different options for your plus quilt adventures! 5-page PDF pattern includes: - Yardage Requirements and Cutting Instructions - Layout Diagrams - Quilt Top Assembly Instructions - Limited Quilt Finishing Instructions Fabric requirements can be seen in the second image. *Please note this is a PDF pattern download, you will need Adobe Reader to view this pattern. *You will receive an email (to your paypal address), with the instructions and link for downloading the pattern. Please note the link expires after 3 downloads, so be sure to save the pattern to your computer!

name: Vintage Nine-Patch Quilt PDF Pattern
description: This sweet take on a traditional nine-patch design is great for showing off your favorite fabrics or clearing out your scrap bin! Inspired by a quilt made by my Great-Great-Grandmother, the Vintage Nine-Patch Quilt. Pattern is suitable for comfortable beginners! Quilt Finishes at 62”x77”. 5-page PDF pattern includes: - Yardage Requirements and Cutting Instructions - Block Assembly Instructions - Quilt Assembly Instructions Fabric Requirements: - 20 fat quarters (or 40 for more variety!) - 2 yards of solid background fabric - 4 3/4 yards of backing fabric - 2 yards of 90” wide cotton batting - 1/2 yard of binding fabric Piece totals are included for cutting from scraps. *Please note this is a PDF pattern download, you will need Adobe Reader to view this pattern. *You will receive an email (to your paypal address), with the instructions and link for downloading the pattern. Please note the link expires after 3 downloads, so be sure to save the pattern to your computer!
